intro: Sida kansana, commonly known as the yellow mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its hairy stems and serrated leaf edges are distinctive botanical features. Sida kansana is also noted for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in various environments.
